MajorClaims.MC1: students should be free not to attend classes
MajorClaims.MC2: it is clear that going to classes should be optional for students

Claims.C1: it improves the quality of student life as well as their learning motivation and teaches important life skills
Claims.C2: I hold this belief due to the improvement of students' current experience as well as the valuable skills and knowledge they obtain for their whole life afterwards
Claims.C3: some students might learn better at home on their own, for instance, by reading the textbook
Claims.C4: being free to stay away from classes improves flexibility and therefore quality of student life
Claims.C5: By giving students the freedom to choose about class attendance they might rather be thinking about why they decided to study and learn to motivate themselves

Premises.P1: This problem occurs especially if the lecturer is lethargic
Premises.P2: By letting students choose not to attend class you give them the opportunity to escape bad teaching
Premises.P3: they are able to save precious study time and dive into the course syllabus independently
Premises.P4: Sometimes the wild party on Thursday night is too good to end already at midnight only because of a lecture on Friday in the morning
Premises.P5: With a liberal policy students are able to postpone the learning to the afternoon which gives a feeling of freedom and improves time efficiency
Premises.P6: Research has shown that the more satisfied the students are with those life aspects, the better they perform in academic areas
Premises.P7: Intrinsic motivation is known to be much more desirable because it leads to better learning and well-being
Premises.P8: These are crucial skills for the duration of their study and their whole life time
Premises.P9: in order to gain intrinsic motivation students need to become aware of their strengths and aims
